canResize.description:
Can the item be resized at all, and if so, can all or only one edge be resized?

You cannot disable resizing. This is becuase dash does not
generate literal unions with primitive types well. See https://github.com/plotly/dash/issues/3017
"both": can be resized at both edges
"left": can only be resized at the left edge
"right": can only be resized at the right edge
canResize.name: union

canChangeGroup.description: Can the item be moved to a different group?
canChangeGroup.name: bool

style.description: Dict with CSS styles to apply to the item
style.name: objectOf

hoverInfo.description: Hover information for the item, can be html to show.
hoverInfo.name: string

is_fixed.description: Is the item fixed in position
is_fixed.name: bool

inputs.description:
If you want some input fields to be shown for the item, you can specify them here.

When the input field changes it will update the `selectedItemInput` prop with the new values.
Which can be used in a callback to update the item data.
inputs.name: objectOf

default_time_start.description: Default start time for the timeline

default_time_end.description: Default end time for the timeline

drag_snap.description: Snap dragged items to a time interval (in milliseconds)

context_menu_options.description: Options to show in the right click context menu

enable_week_headers.description: Enable week headers when zoomed between 1 and 2 weeks visible. Defaults to false

week_header_max_days.description: Maximum number of days visible to show week headers. Defaults to 21 (3 weeks)

deselected_legend_items.description: Legend items that are not selected

locale.description: dayjs locale to use for date formatting. Defaults to 'en'. Should be one of "en", "de", "sv", "nl"

use_resize_handle.description: Should you only be able to resize from the ends? Defaults to true

clickedItem.description: The item that was clicked, if any.

canResize.description:
Can the item be resized at all, and if so, can all or only one edge be resized?

You cannot disable resizing. This is becuase dash does not
generate literal unions with primitive types well. See https://github.com/plotly/dash/issues/3017
"both": can be resized at both edges
"left": can only be resized at the left edge
"right": can only be resized at the right edge
canResize.name: union

canChangeGroup.description: Can the item be moved to a different group?
canChangeGroup.name: bool

style.description: Dict with CSS styles to apply to the item
style.name: objectOf

hoverInfo.description: Hover information for the item, can be html to show.
hoverInfo.name: string

is_fixed.description: Is the item fixed in position
is_fixed.name: bool

inputs.description:
If you want some input fields to be shown for the item, you can specify them here.

When the input field changes it will update the `selectedItemInput` prop with the new values.
Which can be used in a callback to update the item data.
inputs.name: objectOf

time.description: The time (in milliseconds since epoch) where the right click happened.
time.name: number

group_id.description: The group id where the right click happened
group_id.name: union

option.description: The option that was clicked, defined in the context menu
option.name: string

skuChanged.description: SKU number of the item that was changed for the selected item

isFixedChanged.description: Is fixed value of the item that was changed for the selected item

type.name: shape
type.raw: { data: any; time: number; groupId: string | number; }

id.description: Unique ID to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

setProps.description:
Update props to trigger callbacks.

NOTE: The setPropsType cannot be used, as it otherwise thinks
it is a required argument when creating the dash component.
